【0】 EXAMINATION:  ELBOW, AP AND LAT VIEWS RIGHT

【1】 INDICATION:  ___ year old man with elbow pain from recent trauma in elbow extension, please evaluate for avulsion or other lesion.  // ___ year old man with elbow pain from recent trauma in elbow extension, please evaluate for avulsion or other lesion. TECHNIQUE:  Three views

【2】 COMPARISON:  None

【3】 FINDINGS: 

【4】 No effusion is demonstrated.  Minimal degenerative spurring.  No definite fracture.  Unusual lucent line is demonstrated on the oblique view at the medial aspect of the capitellum.  This would be an unusual pattern for fracture.  Alternative considerations include an area of osteophytosis or small intra-articular body.  No embedded radiopaque foreign body.

【5】 IMPRESSION: 

【6】 No definite fracture and the absence of a joint effusion the setting of trauma is reassuring.  There is a faint equivocal lucency in the medial aspect of the capitellum, of uncertain etiology.  A nondisplaced fracture is not excluded but this would be an atypical pattern for this.

【7】 RECOMMENDATION: Clinical correlation, consider assessment with MRI if clinically indicated.

There is increased interstitial opacification of the right lower lung with patchy opacification of the middle right lung.  There is a persistent left pleural effusion in the left lung which appears similar to previous.  There is mildly increased pulmonary vascular congestion..  There is no pneumothorax.  There is moderate enlargement of the heart.  There is a tortuous and calcified aorta.

【6】 IMPRESSION: 

【7】 Increased right middle and lower consolidation consistent with a new pneumonia, with a possible slight increase in pulmonary vascular congestion.

【0】 BILATERAL DIGITAL SCREENING MAMMOGRAM WITH CAD

【1】 CLINICAL INDICATION:  Family history of breast cancer, interval 10-pound weight loss, screening.

【2】 Best possible images were obtained in this patient with a tender breast during compression.

【3】 Comparison is made to the patient's previous studies dated ___, ___ and ___.

【4】 The breast tissues are heterogeneously dense which does lower the sensitivity of mammography.  No suspicious mass, area of architectural distortion, or cluster of suspicious microcalcification is seen.

【5】 This study was interpreted with the aid of the ICAD computer-aided detection system.

【6】 IMPRESSION:

【7】 1.  Dense breast tissues.  No specific mammographic evidence of malignancy.

【8】 BI-RADS 1 - negative.

【0】 INDICATION:  ___ man with a right ureter stone.

【1】 TECHNIQUE:  Total of 8 fluoroscopic-guided images were obtained during bilateral retrograde pyelograms.  

【2】 FINDINGS: Initial scout images show a stone at the expected location of the right ureter. Subsequent images after injection of contrast in the right ureter show a filling defect in the mid ureter with proximal dilatation consistent with an obstructing kidney stone. Subsequently, a right ureter stent was placed. There was moderate hydronephrosis in the right renal pelvis.  A left retrograde pyelogram was showed normal opacification without filling defects. The patient is s/p right hemiarthroplasty of the hip.  

【3】 For details, please see separate report by the urology department on OMR.

【0】 INDICATION:  ___ female with hematuria.

【1】 COMPARISON:  CT abdomen and pelvis with contrast ___ renal ultrasound ___.

【2】 TECHNIQUE:  Contiguous axial images were obtained through the base of the lungs to the pubic symphysis with the administration of IV contrast.  Patient was premedicated due to history of contrast allergy.  Multiplanar reformats were generated and reviewed.

【3】 CT OF THE ABDOMEN:  Visualized lung bases are clear with no focal consolidation or pleural effusion.  The visualized heart and pericardium are unremarkable.

【4】 The liver shows no focal lesions.  The pancreas, spleen, bilateral adrenal glands and gallbladder appear unremarkable.  Both kidneys enhance and excrete contrast symmetrically with no evidence of hydronephrosis or stones.  Bilateral subcentimeter hypodensities are noted within the kidneys that are too small to characterize.  Intra-abdominal loops of large and small bowel are unremarkable.  There is no free air or free fluid within the abdomen.  Retroperitoneal and mesenteric lymph nodes do not meet CT size criteria for pathologic enlargement.  Intra-abdominal vasculature is unremarkable.

【5】 CT OF THE PELVIS:  The bladder, distal ureters, rectum and sigmoid colon appear unremarkable aside from colonic diverticula and redundent sigmoid.  There is no free pelvic fluid.  Pelvic lymph nodes do not meet CT size criteria for pathologic enlargement.

【6】 OSSEOUS STRUCTURES:  Multilevel degenerative changes are noted within the lumbosacral spine, most prominent at L5-S1; however, no focal lytic or sclerotic lesion suspicious for malignancy identified.

【7】 IMPRESSION:

【8】 1.  No evidence of renal calculi, hydronephrosis or other pathology to explain patient's symptoms. No concerning renal mass.

【9】 2.  Hypodensities within the bilateral kidneys are too small to characterize but likely represent simple cysts.

【10】 3.  Degenerative changes noted within the lumbosacral spine.

【0】 STUDY:  Two images of the frontal chest and two images of the left ribs ___. Note images were provided for review on ___.

【1】 ___ chest radiograph.  

【2】 INDICATION:  Question fracture left anterior/lateral lower ribs, BB on x-rays.

【3】  FINDINGS:  Prior median sternotomy.  Prior mitral valve replacement.  Unchanged heart and mediastinum.  No pleural fluid identified.  Clear lungs.  Degenerative changes of the thoracic spine incompletely evaluated.  No definite rib lesions.  No definite displaced rib fractures.

【0】 INDICATION:  ___ y/o male with cholangiocarcinoma, s/p metallic stent with history of recurrent cholangitis requiring left sided PTBD placement long term. Patient presents for routine exchange.

【1】 COMPARISON:  Abdominopelvic CT dated ___.  Biliary catheter replacement dated ___.

【2】 TECHNIQUE:  OPERATORS: Dr. ___ and Dr. ___ radiologist performed the procedure. Dr. ___ supervised the trainee during the key components of the procedure and has reviewed and agrees with the trainee's findings. ANESTHESIA: Moderate sedation was provided by administrating divided doses of 50 mcg of fentanyl and 1 mg of midazolam throughout the total intra-service time of 25 min during which the patient's hemodynamic parameters were continuously monitored by an independent trained radiology nurse. 1% lidocaine was injected in the skin and subcutaneous tissues overlying the access site MEDICATIONS: Midazolam, fentanyl. CONTRAST: 20 ml of Optiray contrast. FLUOROSCOPY TIME AND DOSE: 8.6 min, 44 mGy

【3】 PROCEDURE: 1. Over-the-wire cholangiogram through existing left percutaneous transhepatic biliary drainage access. 2. Exchange of the existing percutaneous trans-hepatic biliary drainage catheter with a new 12 ___ PTBD catheter. PROCEDURE DETAILS: Following the discussion of the risks, benefits and alternatives to the procedure, written informed consent was obtained from the patient. The patient was then brought to the angiography suite and placed supine on the exam table. A pre-procedure time-out was performed per ___ protocol. The mid abdomen was prepped and draped in the usual sterile fashion.

【4】 Initial scout image which was saved on PACS showed the biliary drain to be in the appropriate position.  Following the instillation of lidocaine jelly into the skin site, the left catheter was cut and ___ wire was advanced through the catheter into the duodenum.  The catheter was removed.  A pull back over the wire cholangiogram was then performed through a ___ x 25cm sheath.  The sheath was removed and a new destrung 12 ___ percutaneous trans hepatic biliary drainage catheter was advanced into the duodenum. Side holes were positioned above and below the level of obstruction to facilitate internal drainage. The wire and inner stiffener were removed, the catheter was flushed, the loop was formed, the catheter was attached to a bag and sterile dressings were applied. The patient tolerated the procedure well and there were no immediate post-procedure complications.

【5】 FINDINGS:

【6】  1. Existing left percutaneous transhepatic biliary drainage catheter in appropriate position through a metallic stent. 2. Over-the-wire cholangiogram showed an occluded metallic stent. 3. Successful exchange of ___ destrung percutaneous transhepatic biliary drainage catheters with new ___ destrung  catheter through metallic stent.

【7】 IMPRESSION: 

【8】 Successful exchange of existing percutaneous transhepatic biliary drainage catheter with new ___ destrung left percutaneous transhepatic biliary drain catheter.

【0】 CLINICAL INFORMATION:  ___ man with metastatic lung cancer.  Rule out metastatic disease.

【1】 COMPARISON:  MRI of the brain dated ___ and priors.

【2】 TECHNIQUE:  Multisequence multiplanar imaging of the cervical spine was performed both prior to and following the intravenous administration of 6 mL Gadavist.

【3】 FINDINGS:  There is a T2 hyperintense, T2 hypointense heterogeneously enhancing mass in the clivus which is partially visualized but measures at least 29 x 23 mm.  This appears similar to the prior head MRI.  The vertebral bodies are normal in height and alignment. There is heterogeneous marrow signal throughout the vertebral bodies. The spinal cord and the craniocervical junction are normal in appearance.  There is no abnormal enhancement in the spine.  The paraspinal soft tissues are unremarkable.

【4】 At C2-C3, there is uncovertebral joint osteophyte formation and facet joint degenerative changes resulting in mild bilateral neural foraminal narrowing.

【5】 At C3-C4, there is a posterior disc bulge with osteophyte formation as well as uncovertebral and facet joint degenerative changes resulting in mild narrowing of the spinal canal and mild bilateral neural foraminal narrowing.

【6】 At C4-C5, there is a central disc protrusion with osteophyte formation as well as facet and uncovertebral joint degenerative changes resulting in moderate narrowing of the spinal canal and indentation on the spinal cord without associated signal change and mild left neural foraminal narrowing.

【7】 At C5-C6, there is a central disc protrusion with osteophyte formation as well as bilateral facets and uncovertebral joint degenerative changes.  This results in moderate narrowing of the spinal canal with contact on the spinal cord but no associated spinal cord signal abnormality and mild bilateral neural foraminal narrowing.

【8】 At C6-C7, there is a central disc protrusion with osteophyte formation with uncovertebral and facet joint degenerative changes.  There is contact on the spinal cord.  There is moderate spinal canal narrowing and mild-to-moderate bilateral neural foraminal narrowing.

【9】 The C7-T1 level is unremarkable.

【10】 IMPRESSION: 1.  Enhancing clival mass which is partially evaluated appears similar to prior head MRI in ___ but is apparently new from ___.  This is most likely metastatic disease.   2.  Heterogeneous marrow signal may reflect post treatment changes or infiltrative marrow process. There is no focal lesion. 3.  Multilevel cervical spine degenerative changes as described above.

【0】 HISTORY:  Right great toe ulcer.  Assess for bony structures.

【1】 TECHNIQUE:  Three views of the right foot.

【2】 COMPARISON:  None available.

【3】 FINDINGS:

【4】 There is mild to moderate joint space narrowing with subchondral sclerosis and osseous spurring of the first metatarsophalangeal joint.  There is soft tissue ulceration along the medial aspect of the interphalangeal joint of the right great toe.  There is a mild hallux valgus deformity. 

【5】 There is prominent cortical irregularity and thickening of the third and fourth metatarsals consistent with healed fractures.  There are multiple punctate bullet fragments within the right forefoot.   

【6】 IMPRESSION:

【7】 1.  Soft tissue ulceration of the medial aspect of the right great toe with no radiographic evidence of osteomyelitis.  MR examination would provide further imaging evaluation if clinically warranted. 

【8】 2.  Healed fractures of the third and fourth metacarpals with multiple bullet fragments within the right midfoot. 

【9】 3.  Mild to moderate degenerative joint disease and bunion of the right first metatarsophalangeal joint.

【4】 FINDINGS:

No focal consolidation, pleural effusion or pneumothorax is detected.  Minimal atelectasis is seen in the left lung base.  There are no acute osseous abnormalities.

【0】 INDICATION:  ___ male with two-week history of productive cough, here to evaluate for pneumonia.

【1】 TECHNIQUE:  PA and lateral radiographs of the chest.

【2】 COMPARISON:  Chest radiograph, last performed on ___.

【3】 The inspiratory lung volumes are appropriate.  The lungs are clear without pleural effusion, focal consolidation or pneumothorax.  The pulmonary vasculature is not engorged.  The cardiac silhouette is normal in size.  Minimal calcification at the aortic knob is noted with marked tortuosity of the thoracic aorta.  The mediastinal and hilar contours are within normal limits.  A stable irregularity at the distal right clavicle is noted.  Degenerative changes are present in the thoracic spine.

【0】 EXAMINATION:  MR HIP ___/ ARTHROGRAM LEFT

【1】 INDICATION:  ___ year old man with persistent l hip pain chronic ___ yrs  // labral tear  PLEASE INJECT L HIP WITH KENALOG AND BUPIVICAINE AT THE TIME OF ARTHROGRAM

【2】 TECHNIQUE:  Multiplanar images of the left hip hip were performed following the administration of intra-articular contrast, Kenalog, and bupivicaine on a 1.5 T MRI scanner using a routine hip arthrogram protocol.

【3】 COMPARISON:  None available.

【4】 FINDINGS: 

【5】 Contrast is seen within the left hip joint.

【6】 There are large marginal osteophytes of the femoral head and acetabulum.  There is severe femoral acetabular joint space narrowing with complete cartilage loss of the superior femoral acetabular joint, and surrounding bone marrow edema and subchondral cystic change (series 4, images 10 and 11).  There is a detached superior labral tear (4, 13).  There is a paralabral cyst adjacent to the superior labral tear measuring approximately 18 x 7 mm (2, 3) which causes cystic changes along the adjacent acetabulum.  There is no avascular necrosis or stress fracture.  There is no greater trochanteric bursitis.  The visualized musculature surrounding the left hip is normal in bulk and signal.

【7】 Limited evaluation of the intrapelvic contents are within normal limits.

【8】 IMPRESSION: 

【9】 Severe degenerative changes of the left hip with complete cartilage loss superiorly, bone marrow edema and subchondral cystic change.

【10】 Detached superior labral tear with adjacent paralabral cyst.

【0】 EXAMINATION:  CT HEAD W/O CONTRAST

【1】 INDICATION:  ___ year old man with DM and CKD presented with hypertensive emergency now with worsening headache and vomiting.// Assess for intracranial pathology ___ hypertenisve emergency

【2】 TECHNIQUE:  Routine unenhanced head CT was performed and viewed in brain, intermediate and bone windows.  Coronal and sagittal reformats were also performed.

【3】 DOSE:   Acquisition sequence:    1) Sequenced Acquisition 16.0 s, 16.2 cm; CTDIvol = 49.5 mGy (Head) DLP = 802.7 mGy-cm.  Total DLP (Head) = 803 mGy-cm.

【4】 COMPARISON:  CTs head ___ and ___

【5】 FINDINGS: 

【6】 There is no intra-axial or extra-axial hemorrhage, edema, shift of normally midline structures, or evidence of acute major vascular territorial infarction. Ventricles and sulci are within expected limits and size and configuration.

【7】 There is mild mucosal thickening of the bilateral ethmoid air cells and both sphenoid sinuses.  Ear cavities are well aerated. The bony calvarium is intact.  Patient is status post right ocular silicone injection.

【8】 IMPRESSION: 

【9】 No acute intracranial abnormality on noncontrast CT head.  Specifically, no acute large territory infarct or intracranial hemorrhage.

【0】 ABDOMEN

【1】 HISTORY:  Hepatic encephalopathy.  Constipation, rule out free air.

【2】 SUPINE AND LEFT LATERAL DECUBITUS VIEWS:  There are nonspecific air-fluid levels on the lateral decubitus view.  No free air is identified and the bowel gas pattern is otherwise unremarkable.  Hazy increased density in the abdomen consistent with ascites.  Soft tissue shadows are indistinct.  No significant bony abnormality is identified.

【3】 IMPRESSION:  No evidence of free air.  Question of ascites.  Nonspecific air-fluid levels.

【0】 INDICATION:  ___ year old man with metastatic RCC who has refractory N/V.// ?evidence of obstruction from malignancy, ?progression of lesions

【1】 TECHNIQUE:  Single phase split bolus contrast: MDCT axial images were acquired through the abdomen and pelvis following intravenous contrast administration with split bolus technique. Oral contrast was not administered. Coronal and sagittal reformations were performed and reviewed on PACS.

【2】 DOSE:  Acquisition sequence:    1) Sequenced Acquisition 0.5 s, 0.2 cm; CTDIvol = 9.3 mGy (Body) DLP = 1.9 mGy-cm.    2) Stationary Acquisition 30.6 s, 0.2 cm; CTDIvol = 521.0 mGy (Body) DLP = 104.2 mGy-cm.    3) Spiral Acquisition 8.8 s, 57.4 cm; CTDIvol = 25.9 mGy (Body) DLP = 1,470.0 mGy-cm.  Total DLP (Body) = 1,576 mGy-cm.

【3】 COMPARISON:  CT ___

【4】 FINDINGS: 

【5】 LOWER CHEST: Small bilateral pleural effusions, left side greater than right, similar to prior exam.  There is bibasilar atelectasis present.  A metastatic nodule at the right lung base measures 1.8 cm, previously 1.5 cm.  A metastatic nodule at the left lung base measures 1.5 cm, previously 1.4 cm.

【6】 ABDOMEN:

【7】 HEPATOBILIARY: There has been interval increase in the size of multiple hypoattenuating liver lesions.  For example an lesion at the liver dome currently measures 6.7 x 4.7 cm, previously 5.7 x 4.0 cm.  A lesion in segment ___ measures 8.0 x 6.2 cm, previously 6.6 x 5.3 cm.  There is no evidence of intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary dilatation.  The gallbladder is within normal limits.  There is mild abdominal ascites.

【8】 PANCREAS: The head and neck of the pancreas appear within normal limits without ductal dilatation.  Patient is status post distal pancreatectomy.  The resection margin abuts the large left upper quadrant abdominal mass.

【9】 SPLEEN: Patient is status post splenectomy

【10】 ADRENALS: The right adrenal gland appears unremarkable.

【11】 URINARY: The patient is status post left nephrectomy.  The right kidney enhances homogeneously and is without hydronephrosis.

【12】 GASTROINTESTINAL: The patient's known large left upper quadrant mass is similar in size currently measuring 24.3 x 10.7 cm, previously 23.2 x 10.7 cm. This mass exerts significant mass effect on the gastric cardia and body.  There is no visible fat plane between the mass and the gastric cardia and invasion of the gastric wall cannot be excluded.  This mass appears to extend into the anterior abdominal wall anteriorly an adjacent mass in the central mesentery is stable in size measuring up to 11 cm (series 5, image 39).  There are multiple additional necrotic appearing mesenteric masses (series 5, images 46, 56).  The lesion with associated fluid collection at the upper portion of the left psoas muscle is decreased in size currently measuring up to 2.5 cm, previously measuring up to 3.5 cm.  Enhancing soft tissue implant at the lower aspect of the left psoas muscle (series 5, image 57) is slightly larger than prior exam measuring 1.6 cm, previously 1.1 cm a presacral soft tissue lesion posterior to the rectum is stable in size measuring 8.0 x 5.3 cm.

【13】 There is an enteric tube with the distal tip in the gastric cardia.  There is no evidence of small bowel obstruction.  There is a surgical anastomosis seen in the colon.  A calcified tubular structure in the right lower quadrant is stable.  There is no intraperitoneal free air.  However, the small bowel and colon are inseparable from multiple peritoneal/mesenteric metastatic lesions.

【14】 PELVIS: The urinary bladder and distal ureter is unremarkable.  There is mild pelvic ascites.

【15】 REPRODUCTIVE ORGANS: The visualized reproductive organs are unremarkable.

【16】 LYMPH NODES: There are multiple enlarged upper abdominal, mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes.  For example, a large necrotic appearing left para-aortic lymph node is stable in size measuring 3.8 x 3.0 cm (series 5 image 49).  Metastatic necrotic conglomerate lymph nodes just below the aortic bifurcation erodes the anterior portion of the S1 vertebral body.  There is no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy.

【17】 VASCULAR: There is no abdominal aortic aneurysm.  Mild atherosclerotic disease is noted.

【18】 BONES: There are mild degenerative changes in the spine.  There is bilateral spondylolysis at L5.  There is an osseous destructive lesion involving the right-sided pedicle of L2 suspicious for osseous metastatic disease.  A portion of this extends into the spinal canal and may be exerting mass effect on the spinal cord.

【19】 SOFT TISSUES: There is an area of abnormal enhancement in the left lateral abdominal wall measuring up to 5.2 cm (series 5, image 44).  This appears more well-defined than on the prior exam.  This could represent extension of the metastatic lesion at the site of prior catheter placement.  Infection/phlegmonous changes cannot be completely excluded.  There is diffuse subcutaneous edema.

【20】 IMPRESSION:

【21】  1. Large left upper quadrant abdominal mass which exerts significant mass effect on the stomach with possible invasion of the gastric cardia.  This is not significantly changed from the prior exam. 2. There is no evidence of small bowel obstruction or intraperitoneal free air.  However, portions of the small bowel and colon are inseparable from metastatic mesenteric/peritoneal lesions. 3. Interval increase in size of multiple liver metastases as well as metastatic nodules at the lung bases. 4. Additional metastatic mesenteric, peritoneal and retroperitoneal lesions are similar in size, including a presacral lesion posterior to the rectum. 5. Stable mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy. 6. Osseous lesion involving the right-sided pedicle of L2 compatible with a metastasis.  Portion of this extends into the spinal canal and may exert mass effect on the spinal cord. 7. Abnormal enhancement in the left lateral abdominal wall at the site of prior catheter placement.  This is contiguous with a left pericolic gutter metastatic lesion and may represent additional growth of metastatic tumor.  Infection/phlegmon cannot be excluded.

【22】 NOTIFICATION:  The findings were discussed with ___, M.D. by ___ ___, M.D. on the telephone on ___ at 10:04 am, 20 minutes after discovery of the findings.

【0】 INDICATION:  ___ with neck pain.

【1】 TECHNIQUE:  Multiplanar MRI sequences of the cervical and lumbar spine were obtained.

【2】 COMPARISON:  There are no comparison studies available.

【3】 MRI OF THE C-SPINE:  

【4】 The vertebral bodies of the C-spine are preserved.  There are no bone marrow abnormalities. There is no prevertebral soft tissue swelling. 

【5】 C2/C3: there are no significant degenerative changes.

【6】 C3/C4: there are no significant degenerative changes.

【7】 C4/C5: mild diffuse posterior disc bulging with mild spinal canal and left neural foraminal narrowing.

【8】 C5/C6: there is a only minimal diffuse posterior disc bulge, but no spinal canal or neural foraminal narrowing.

【9】 C6/C7 and C7/T1, there are no significant degenerative changes.  The paravertebral soft tissues are normal.

【10】  MRI OF THE  LUMBAR SPINE:  There are no bone marrow abnormalities. The para-vertebral soft tissues and partially visualized abdominal aorta appears normal.   There is a right medial mid pole and left T2 hyerintense renal lesions, likely cysts.(series 10, image 2).

【11】 There are no significant degenerative changes at the L1/L2, L2/L3 and L3/4 levels. 

【12】 At L4/L5, there is mild intervertebral disc disease with an annular fissure tear at the left lateral disc at L4/L5.  There is mild posterior disc bulging with possible contact to the exiting left L4 nerve root in the left neural impingement.

【13】 At L5/S1, there is mild left eccentric posterior disc bulging and possible contact with the exiting L5 nerve root (series 10, image 23) 

【14】  IMPRESSION: Mild-to-moderate posterior disc bulging at L4/L5 and L5/S1 with contact to the exiting L4 and L5 nerve roots on the left and a small annular fissure tear at L4/L5.

【0】 CLINICAL INDICATION:  Left upper quadrant pain.
